Description: Learn more about new research utilizing IHC and H&E whole-slide images to predict gene expression and CD8+ immune phenotype based on quantitative tumor microenvironment features including nuclear, cell and tissue features using quantities, density and spatial relationships. This presentation includes AI-driven modeling of tertiary lymphoid structures and KEAP1 as well as predictions of homologous recombination deficiency and whole-genome doubling in breast and prostate cancers. A closing panel will discuss implications and potential applications to clinical development and diagnostic development using AI-powered pathology.
SearchResultBody: ESP21. PathAI: New advancements in AI-powered pathology and predicting immune phenotypes and genomic alterations from whole-slide images
Title: PathAI: New advancements in AI-powered pathology and predicting immune phenotypes and genomic alterations from whole-slide images
